title: Number Sense Interventions for Students with Dyscalculia
authors: Smith, J., Johnson, M., & Brown, K.
summary: This study examines the effectiveness of targeted number sense interventions for students diagnosed with dyscalculia. Results show significant improvement in basic arithmetic skills after 12 weeks of intervention.

title: Working Memory and Mathematical Performance in Dyscalculia
authors: Davis, L., Wilson, R., & Taylor, S.
summary: Research investigating the relationship between working memory capacity and mathematical performance in individuals with dyscalculia. Findings suggest targeted working memory training may improve math outcomes.

title: Early Identification of Dyscalculia Risk Factors
authors: Anderson, P., Martinez, C., & Lee, H.
summary: A longitudinal study identifying early risk factors for dyscalculia in preschool children. Key predictors include difficulties with subitizing, number comparison, and spatial processing.
